Name: Reaction engine
Description: A reaction engine is an engine which provides propulsion by expelling reaction mass, in accordance with Newton's third law of motion. This includes the following categories: Turbines, Turbojet, Turbofan, Rocket-powered, Motorjet, Pulsejet, Ramjet and Scramjet.

Properties.Name: Specific fuel consumption
Properties.Description: The fuel efficiency of the engine (grams of fuel per second-kilonewton)

Properties.Name: Specific impulse
Properties.Description: The efficiency of the engine as described by the impulse (change in momentum) per unit of propellant.
